trans-unit.source: Wrap Android apps with App Wrapping Tool | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Wrap Android apps with App Wrapping Tool | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Use the information in this topic to learn how to wrap your Android apps without modifying the code of the app itself.
trans-unit.target: Use the information in this topic to learn how to wrap your Android apps without modifying the code of the app itself.

trans-unit.source: Prepare the apps so you can apply mobile app management policies.
trans-unit.target: Prepare the apps so you can apply mobile app management policies.

trans-unit.source: Prepare Android apps for mobile application management with the Intune App Wrapping Tool
trans-unit.target: Prepare Android apps for mobile application management with the Intune App Wrapping Tool

trans-unit.source: Use the **Microsoft Intune App Wrapping Tool for Android** to modify the behavior of your in-house Android apps to let you configure features of the app without modifying the code of the app itself.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Microsoft Intune App Wrapping Tool for Android** to modify the behavior of your in-house Android apps to let you configure features of the app without modifying the code of the app itself.

trans-unit.source: The tool is a Windows command-line application that runs in PowerShell and creates a ‘wrapper’ around your app.
trans-unit.target: The tool is a Windows command-line application that runs in PowerShell and creates a ‘wrapper’ around your app.

trans-unit.source: Once the app is processed, you can then change the app’s functionality using [mobile application management policies](configure-and-deploy-mobile-application-management-policies-in-the-microsoft-intune-console.md) that you configure.
trans-unit.target: Once the app is processed, you can then change the app’s functionality using [mobile application management policies](configure-and-deploy-mobile-application-management-policies-in-the-microsoft-intune-console.md) that you configure.

trans-unit.source: Before running the tool, review the [Security considerations for running the app wrapping tool](#security-considerations-for-running-the-app-wrapping-tool).
trans-unit.target: Before running the tool, review the [Security considerations for running the app wrapping tool](#security-considerations-for-running-the-app-wrapping-tool).

trans-unit.source: To download the tool, see [Microsoft Intune App Wrapping Tool for Android](https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=47267).
trans-unit.target: To download the tool, see [Microsoft Intune App Wrapping Tool for Android](https://www.microsoft.com/download/details.aspx?id=47267).

trans-unit.source: The version of the app wrapping tool, which supports devices not enrolled in Intune, is available for public preview.
trans-unit.target: The version of the app wrapping tool, which supports devices not enrolled in Intune, is available for public preview.

trans-unit.source: If you wish to participate in the public preview, you can download the tool from [this github page](https://github.com/msintuneappsdk/intune-app-wrapper-android-preview) for Android.
trans-unit.target: If you wish to participate in the public preview, you can download the tool from [this github page](https://github.com/msintuneappsdk/intune-app-wrapper-android-preview) for Android.

trans-unit.source: The scenario is described in the [Protect LOB apps on devices not enrolled in Intune](protect-line-of-business-apps-and-data-on-devices-not-enrolled-in-microsoft-intune.md) topic.
trans-unit.target: The scenario is described in the [Protect LOB apps on devices not enrolled in Intune](protect-line-of-business-apps-and-data-on-devices-not-enrolled-in-microsoft-intune.md) topic.

trans-unit.source: Step 1 Fulfill the prerequisites for using the app wrapping tool
trans-unit.target: Step 1 Fulfill the prerequisites for using the app wrapping tool

trans-unit.source: You must run the app wrapping tool on a Windows computer running Windows 7 or later.
trans-unit.target: You must run the app wrapping tool on a Windows computer running Windows 7 or later.

trans-unit.source: Your input app must be a valid Android application package with the extension **.apk** file and:
trans-unit.target: Your input app must be a valid Android application package with the extension **.apk** file and:

trans-unit.source: Cannot be encrypted
trans-unit.target: Cannot be encrypted

trans-unit.source: Must not have already been wrapped by the app wrapping tool
trans-unit.target: Must not have already been wrapped by the app wrapping tool

trans-unit.source: Must be written for Android 4.0 or later
trans-unit.target: Must be written for Android 4.0 or later

trans-unit.source: The app must be developed by, or for your company.
trans-unit.target: The app must be developed by, or for your company.

trans-unit.source: You cannot use this tool to process apps downloaded from the Google Play Store.
trans-unit.target: You cannot use this tool to process apps downloaded from the Google Play Store.

trans-unit.source: To run the app wrapping tool, you must install the latest version of the [Java Runtime Environment](http://java.com/download/) and then ensure that the Java path variable has been set to **C:\ProgramData\Oracle\Java\javapath** in your Windows environment variables.
trans-unit.target: To run the app wrapping tool, you must install the latest version of the [Java Runtime Environment](http://java.com/download/) and then ensure that the Java path variable has been set to **C:\ProgramData\Oracle\Java\javapath** in your Windows environment variables.

trans-unit.source: For more help, see your [Java documentation](http://java.com/download/help/).
trans-unit.target: For more help, see your [Java documentation](http://java.com/download/help/).

trans-unit.source: In some cases, the 32-bit version of Java may result in memory issues.
trans-unit.target: In some cases, the 32-bit version of Java may result in memory issues.

trans-unit.source: We recommend that you install the 64-bit version instead.
trans-unit.target: We recommend that you install the 64-bit version instead.

trans-unit.source: Step 2 Install the app wrapping tool
trans-unit.target: Step 2 Install the app wrapping tool

trans-unit.source: From the Microsoft Download Center, download and open the installation file for the app wrapping tool to a Windows computer.
trans-unit.target: From the Microsoft Download Center, download and open the installation file for the app wrapping tool to a Windows computer.

trans-unit.source: Accept the license agreement, then complete the installation.
trans-unit.target: Accept the license agreement, then complete the installation.

trans-unit.source: Note the folder to which you installed the tool.
trans-unit.target: Note the folder to which you installed the tool.

trans-unit.source: The default location is: **C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Intune Mobile Application Management\Android\App Wrapping Tool**.
trans-unit.target: The default location is: **C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Intune Mobile Application Management\Android\App Wrapping Tool**.

trans-unit.source: Step 3 Run the app wrapping tool
trans-unit.target: Step 3 Run the app wrapping tool

trans-unit.source: On the Windows computer where you installed the app wrapping tool, open a PowerShell window in administrator mode.
trans-unit.target: On the Windows computer where you installed the app wrapping tool, open a PowerShell window in administrator mode.

trans-unit.source: From the folder where you installed the tool, import the app wrapping tool PowerShell module:
trans-unit.target: From the folder where you installed the tool, import the app wrapping tool PowerShell module:

trans-unit.source: Run the tool by using the **invoke-AppWrappingTool** command together with the following parameters.
trans-unit.target: Run the tool by using the **invoke-AppWrappingTool** command together with the following parameters.

trans-unit.source: Parameter
trans-unit.target: Parameter

trans-unit.source: More information
trans-unit.target: More information

trans-unit.source: Examples
trans-unit.target: Examples

trans-unit.source: **-InputPath**<String>
trans-unit.target: **-InputPath**<String>

trans-unit.source: Path of the source Android app (.apk).
trans-unit.target: Path of the source Android app (.apk).

trans-unit.source: **-OutputPath**<String>
trans-unit.target: **-OutputPath**<String>

trans-unit.source: Path to the "output" Android app.
trans-unit.target: Path to the "output" Android app.

trans-unit.source: If this is the same directory path as InputPath, the packaging will fail.
trans-unit.target: If this is the same directory path as InputPath, the packaging will fail.

trans-unit.source: **-KeyStorePath**<String>
trans-unit.target: **-KeyStorePath**<String>

trans-unit.source: Path to the keystore file that contains the public/private key pair for signing.
trans-unit.target: Path to the keystore file that contains the public/private key pair for signing.

trans-unit.source: **-KeyStorePassword**<SecureString>
trans-unit.target: **-KeyStorePassword**<SecureString>

trans-unit.source: Password used to decrypt the keystore.
trans-unit.target: Password used to decrypt the keystore.

trans-unit.source: Android requires that all application packages (.apk) to be signed.
trans-unit.target: Android requires that all application packages (.apk) to be signed.

trans-unit.source: Use the Java Key Tool to generate the KeyStorePassword as shown in the example.
trans-unit.target: Use the Java Key Tool to generate the KeyStorePassword as shown in the example.

trans-unit.source: Read more about [keystore](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/security/KeyStore.html).
trans-unit.target: Read more about [keystore](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/security/KeyStore.html).

trans-unit.source: keytool.exe -genkey -v -keystore keystorefile -alias ks -keyalg RSA -keysize 2048 -validity 50000
trans-unit.target: keytool.exe -genkey -v -keystore keystorefile -alias ks -keyalg RSA -keysize 2048 -validity 50000

trans-unit.source: **-KeyAlias**<String>
trans-unit.target: **-KeyAlias**<String>

trans-unit.source: Name of the key to be used for signing.
trans-unit.target: Name of the key to be used for signing.

trans-unit.source: **-KeyPassword**<SecureString>
trans-unit.target: **-KeyPassword**<SecureString>

trans-unit.source: Password used to decrypt the private key that will be used for signing.
trans-unit.target: Password used to decrypt the private key that will be used for signing.

trans-unit.source: **-SigAlg**<SecureString>
trans-unit.target: **-SigAlg**<SecureString>

trans-unit.source: Name of the signature algorithm to be used for signing.
trans-unit.target: Name of the signature algorithm to be used for signing.

trans-unit.source: The algorithm must be compatible with the private key.
trans-unit.target: The algorithm must be compatible with the private key.

trans-unit.source: Examples: SHA256withRSA, SHA1withRSA, MD5withRSA
trans-unit.target: Examples: SHA256withRSA, SHA1withRSA, MD5withRSA

trans-unit.source: **<CommonParameters>** (optional – supports common PowerShell parameters such as verbose, debug, etc.)
trans-unit.target: **<CommonParameters>** (optional – supports common PowerShell parameters such as verbose, debug, etc.)

trans-unit.source: For a list of common parameters, see the [Microsoft Script Center](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh847884.aspx).
trans-unit.target: For a list of common parameters, see the [Microsoft Script Center](https://technet.microsoft.com/library/hh847884.aspx).

trans-unit.source: To see help for the tool, enter the command:
trans-unit.target: To see help for the tool, enter the command:

trans-unit.source: **Example:**
trans-unit.target: **Example:**

trans-unit.source: You will then be prompted for the **KeyStorePassword** and **KeyPassword**.
trans-unit.target: You will then be prompted for the **KeyStorePassword** and **KeyPassword**.

trans-unit.source: The wrapped app is generated, and saved, along with a log file, in the output path you specified.
trans-unit.target: The wrapped app is generated, and saved, along with a log file, in the output path you specified.

trans-unit.source: Security considerations for running the app wrapping tool
trans-unit.target: Security considerations for running the app wrapping tool

trans-unit.source: To prevent potential spoofing, information disclosure, and elevation of privilege attacks:
trans-unit.target: To prevent potential spoofing, information disclosure, and elevation of privilege attacks:

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the input line-of-business application, output application, and Java KeyStore are on the same computer where the app wrapping tool is running.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the input line-of-business application, output application, and Java KeyStore are on the same computer where the app wrapping tool is running.

trans-unit.source: Import the output application to the Intune console on the same computer where the tool is running.
trans-unit.target: Import the output application to the Intune console on the same computer where the tool is running.

trans-unit.source: See [keytool](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/tools/unix/keytool.html) for more information about the Java keytool.
trans-unit.target: See [keytool](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/technotes/tools/unix/keytool.html) for more information about the Java keytool.

trans-unit.source: If the output application and the tool are on a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path and you are not running the tool and input files on the same computer, configure the environment to be secure by using [Internet Protocol Security (IPsec)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPsec) or [Server Message Block (SMB) signing](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/887429).
trans-unit.target: If the output application and the tool are on a Universal Naming Convention (UNC) path and you are not running the tool and input files on the same computer, configure the environment to be secure by using [Internet Protocol Security (IPsec)](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IPsec) or [Server Message Block (SMB) signing](https://support.microsoft.com/en-us/kb/887429).

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the application is coming from a trusted source, which might enable the application to access the AAD token during runtime.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the application is coming from a trusted source, which might enable the application to access the AAD token during runtime.

trans-unit.source: Secure the output directory that contains the wrapped app.
trans-unit.target: Secure the output directory that contains the wrapped app.

trans-unit.source: Consider using a user-level directory for the output.
trans-unit.target: Consider using a user-level directory for the output.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: [Decide how to prepare apps for mobile application management with Microsoft Intune](decide-how-to-prepare-apps-for-mobile-application-management-with-microsoft-intune.md)
trans-unit.target: [Decide how to prepare apps for mobile application management with Microsoft Intune](decide-how-to-prepare-apps-for-mobile-application-management-with-microsoft-intune.md)

trans-unit.source: [Use the SDK to enable apps for mobile application management](use-the-sdk-to-enable-apps-for-mobile-application-management.md)
trans-unit.target: [Use the SDK to enable apps for mobile application management](use-the-sdk-to-enable-apps-for-mobile-application-management.md)
